full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 499-2 Filed 11/23/21 Page 125 of 159124 LBAGmax4 Rocchio - Cross professionals that are giving these answers; right? 1 A. Again, not by name, but certainly there are descriptors of 2 who these individuals are. 3 Q. Well, if we go to those descriptors, we're just talking 4 about a general description of the people that are involved in 5 the study; right? 6 A. I'm not entirely sure. I'd have to look at the article, 7 but I believe there are descriptions about the basis for which 8 they were identified as experts, their level of education and 9 training and the foundation for their publications and areas of 10 expertise. 11 MR. PAGLIUCA: If we could go to Page 3 of this 12 exhibit. 13 Q. Do you see where it's talking about method there? 14 A. I do. 15 Q. So let's start first with this paragraph. "This 16 qualitative study took a phenomenological approach based on 17 data collected as part of a statewide initiative to understand 18 predatory alienation -- a new term created by an advocacy group 19 to describe" and this definition below it. 20 Do you see that? 21 A. I do. 22 Q. Phenomenological means the psychological study of 23 subjective experience; right? 24 A. Yes. 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00007993
